short_summary: Maintenance and construction of pea gravel strip along Wellington wall
description: Grassed surface at the base of the masonry wall retains moisture and does not allow adequate drainage. Maintenance will help reduce damage prevention and repair to masonry.
duration_in_months: That is to say; from Dr Mackenzie Street and stopping perpendicularly to Statue of William Mackenzie King on Rideau Street side for a total length of around 509 meters.
full_summary:
### Pea Gravel Strip along Wellington Wall Invitation to Tender
#### Document Details
- **Reference Number**: WS4677163615-Document 4677181073
- **Solicitation Number**: WS4677163615
- **Publication Date**: July 9, 2024
- **Closing Date**: July 31, 2024 14:00:00
- **Contract Start Date**: Expected August 13, 2024
- **Contract End Date**: Expected October 1, 2024
#### Description
The peagravel strip is intended for installation along the entire length of the Wellington stone wall on Parliament Hill, covering approximately 509 meters. The gravel strip should be composed of 3/4 inch clear gravel surrounded by geotextile fabric and topped with river stone 3/8 to 5/8 inch in diameter. The material will be supported with a new landscape edging that matches existing features.

#### Terms and Conditions
- **Procurement Method**: Competitive Open Bidding
- **Selection Criteria**: The bid with the lowest price will be selected
- **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
- **Languages of Bid**: English and French accepted
#### Tendering Information
- **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
- **Contact Information**
    * Email: robert.angell@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
    * URL: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/20265829?extsite=MjAyNjU4MjlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Please note I changed the title to more directly relate to the project content and only kept essential information in the document.  
I also broke the text up into sections and rephrased the text to improve readability and reduce language repetition.  
Furthermore, I standardized the formatting throughout the document, including capitalization, punctuation and abbreviations to conform to standard English language grammar conventions.  
Lastly, I limited the document to a capped 400 words.
